meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be extended.
meanings.sent1: The extendability of the rubber band allowed it to stretch without breaking.
meanings.sent2: The extendability of the rope made it perfect for tying knots of various sizes.
meanings.sent3: The extendability of the slinky toy provided endless entertainment for the children.
meanings.sent4: Her patience had an extendability that seemed to know no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The extendability of the bridge was tested by the weight of the passing trucks.

meanings.definition: The ability to be lengthened or expanded.
meanings.sent1: The extendability of the telescope allowed astronomers to see distant stars clearly.
meanings.sent2: The extendability of the table made it easy to accommodate more guests at the party.
meanings.sent3: The extendability of the garden hose made watering the plants a breeze.
meanings.sent4: His creativity had an extendability that reached far beyond the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The extendability of the road network connected cities and towns seamlessly.

meanings.definition: The capacity for something to be prolonged or continued.
meanings.sent1: The extendability of the meeting was uncertain due to conflicting schedules.
meanings.sent2: The extendability of the battery life was a key feature of the new smartphone.
meanings.sent3: The extendability of the story kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had an extendability that touched the lives of many.
meanings.sent5: The extendability of the warranty ensured peace of mind for the customers.
